resources.string: Do you want to save record
Do you want to continue with empty record
History of Allergies and Adverse Reactions
Systems Review (General, Cardiovascular, Respiratory, Gastrointestinal, Neurological, Genitourinary, Musculoskeletal)
1)Do you have sensitivity or pain in your teeth?
2)Do you have severe sensitivity of your teeth on having hot and cold foods (or) drinks ?
3)Do you have pain or bleeding in your gums ?
4)Do you have loose teeth , with increasing gaps in between the teeth ?
5)Do you have an unpleasant taste or odor in your mouth?
6)Do you grind your teeth when you sleep?
7)Do you have swelling in your gums with white fluid coming out ?
8)Do you have severe pain in your teeth , do the pain increases at night when you sleep?
9)Do you have pain and swelling in gums covering the lower back teeth region ?
1) Do you have any difficulties in seeing objects (Far objects / Near objects) ?
2) Do you have any Hearing trouble / Ear discharge ?
3) Do you suffer with frequent episodes of Cold / Nasal obstruction / Nasal bleeding ?
4) Do you have any Skin allergies ( Rashes / Itching / Pigmentation ) ?
5) Do you have any Learning difficulties / Excessive sleepiness / Easy fatigue ) ?
6) Do you have any history of Fits ?
7) Do you have any history of Burning Chest ( acidity ) ?
8) Do you have High Blood Pressure ?
10) Do you have any Dental problems like Dental carries / Tooth sensitivity / Other Dental problems ?
School Health Care Screening Program and Referral Card For Children
SCREENING TOOL (FOR AGE: Birth to 6 yrs.)
Head: Abnormally large or small in size/shape deformity. (Measure, Check, Mark -> 2SD; < 2SD) ?
Eyes: Any visible abnormality i.e. white pupil, Squint (important esp., after 3 months), frequent jerky movements, tilting the head when focusing (important esp. after 6 months) ?
Lips and Palate: Cleft (One side or both sides) ?
Difficulty in sucking and swallowing, including sweating on forehead while trying to suck/breast feed (sign is especially important if infants is less than 6 months) ?
HIP: DDH: In case of a female child born through a breech delivery or child walking with a limp or asymmetrical thigh and gluteal skin folds ?
Features Suggestive of Down’s Syndrome - A10 :
Eye: Upward slant of eyes (imaginary line extended from the inner canthus to the outer canthus, goes below the outer canthus), and or epicanthic fold ?
Ears: Low set Ears (Imaginary line extended from inner to outer canthus and to the ear, passes above ear) ?
Palm: Single crease across center of palm (Simian crease) ?
Feet: Wide gap (cleft) between the great and first toe ?

Congenital Heart Disease: Any loud murmur on the chest or cyanosis on lips or bluish spells or features of congestive cardiac failure (Sweating during feeding, recurrent breathing difficulties, poor weight gain, Exercise intolerance, easy fatiguability, bilateral pitting oedema) ?
SAM: Weight for Height/Length: refer if the child is less than -3SD as per WHO chart, counsel if <-2SD ) ?
Severe anaemia: Look for severe palmar pallor ?
Vitamin A Deficiency: Ask for night blindness/look for Bitot’s spot (white patches on sclera) ?
Vitamin D Deficiency: Look for Wrist widening/bowing of legs/nodular swelling on the chest ?

Convulsive Disorder: Ask mother if child ever had spells of unconsciousness and fits include momentary blackouts or momentary loss of contact with real world with or without history of sudden falls or sudden jerky contractions ?
Otitis Media: Did child have more than 3 episode of ear discharge in last 1 year/Look for active discharge from ear ?
Dental Condition: Look for white/brown areas, cavitation, swollen/bleeding/red gums ?
Skin Condition: Does the child have itching on skin (especially at night)/ Look for round or oval scaly patches/pustules in finger webs. Any other lesion on the skin ?
Reactive airway disease: More than 3 Episodes of increased shortness of breath and difficult breathing and wheezing in the past 6 months ?
LOOK,ASK&PERFORM ( GM-Gross Motor, FM-Fine Motor, V-Vision, C-Cognition, H-Hearing, Sp-Speech, S-Social)
FOR AGE : ( Over 2 months but less than 4 months )
Does the child move both arms and both legs freely & equally when awake or when excited? (GM)
Does the child raise his or her head momentarily when lying face down? (GM)
Does the child keep his hands open and relaxed most of the time? (By 3 months) (FM)
Does the child responds to your voice or startles with loud sounds or becomes alert to new sound by quietening or smiling? (H)
Does the child coos or able to vocalise other than crying? Like “ooh” / “ng” (S)
Does the child make eye contact? (Focus their eyes on the eyes of a care giver)? (V)
Does the child give a social smile? (Reciprocal, responds to mother expression or smile i.e. smile back at you) (S)
Does the child suck and swallow well during feeding i.e. without any choking? (Sp)
AS PER AGE : ( Over 4 months but less than 6 months )

Does the child hold head erect in sitting position without bobbing i.e. hold her head straight? (while sitting with support, head is held steadily) Refer if head flops or falls back on any one side when child is pulled to sitting position (GM)

Does the child reach out for an object persistently? (should use either hands but refer if preference for one hand only) Observe that grasp of the object is in the ulnar side of palm and there is lack of thumb involvement (FM)
Does the child respond to mother’s speech by looking directly at her face? (H)
Does the child laugh aloud or make squealing sounds? (Sp)
Does the child follow an object with his or her eyes? (without any visible squint) (V)
Does the child sucks on hands? (C)
AS PER AGE : ( Over 6 months but less than 9 months )
Does the child roll over or turn over in either direction? (GM)
Does the child grasp a small object by using his whole hand? (secures it in the centre of palm) (FM)
Does the child locate source of sounds? I.e. turns his head or eyes if you whisper from behind? (H)
Does the child utter consonant sounds like “p” “b” “m”? (Sp)
Does your baby watch TV or any toy without tilting his/her head? (V)
Does the child raises hands to be picked up by parents? (S)
Does the child look for a spoon or toy that has dropped? (C+V)
AS PER AGE : ( Over 9 months but less than 12 months )
Does the child sit without any support? (GM)
Does the child transfer object from hand to hand? (FM)
Does the child respond to his or her name? (H&C)
Does the child avoid bumping into objects while moving? (V)
Does the child enjoy playing hideandseek (peekaboo)? (S)
AS PER AGE : ( Over 12 months but less than 15 months )
Does the child crawl on hands and knees? (GM)
Does the child pickup small objects using thumb and index finger like peas, raisins (kismis)? (FM)
Does the child stops activity in response to “No”? (H&C)
Does the child say one meaningful word clearly like mama, dada? (Sp)
Does the child imitate action like byebye/clap/kiss? (wave good bye or greet you) (S)
Does the child cry when a stranger picks him up? Differentiates familiar faces from strangers (S&C)
Does the child search for completely hidden objects? (C)
AS PER AGE : ( Over 15 months but less than 18 months )
Does the child play by putting small things or objects into a container? (Cup or Katori) (FM)
Does the child make gestures on verbal request like pointing to objects? (pointing the index finger when asked “Where is the ball” (FM)
Does the child follow simple one step direction as for e.g. “sit down”? (H&C)
Does the child say at least two words other than mama or dada like dog, cat, and ball even if it is not clear? (Sp)
Does the child manipulate or explore a toy with his/her finger like poking or pulling the toy? (C)
AS PER AGE : ( Over 18 months but less than 24 months )
Does the child walk steadily even while pulling a toy? (GM)
Does the child say at least five words consistently even if not clear? (Sp)
Does the child imitate house hold tasks? (try to copy domestic chores like sweeping, washing clothes) (C)
Does the child point to 2 or more body parts? (e.g. show me your nose, child points to nose by using one finger)? (H&C)
AS PER AGE : ( Over 24 months but less than 30 months )
Does the child climb upstairs and downstairs? (GM)
Does the child feed self either with hand or spoon? (FM)
Does the child join 2 words together like mama-milk, car-go? (2 words phrases) (Sp)
Does the child play along with other children? (S)
Does the child enjoy simple pretend play like feeding a doll? (C)
AS PER AGE : ( Over 15 months but less than 18 months )
Does your child look in your eyes for more than a second or two (poor eye contact)?
Does you child ever use his/her index finger to point to ask for something?
Have you ever wondered that your child is deaf or is not responding to his/her name when you call (not communicating even through gestures)?
AS PER AGE : ( Over 18 months but less than 24 months )
Does your child take an interest in other children or play with other children?
Does your child make unusual finger movements/ repetitive hand and body movements like finger Wriggling/ flapping/ spinning/ jumping? (Repeated purposeless motor activity)
Does your child ever pretend play (talk on phone/take care of dolls)?
AS PER AGE : ( Over 30 months but less than 6 years )
Does your child have difficulty in seeing either during day/night? (without spectacles) (V)
Compared with other children of his/her age, did your child have ant delay in walking? (GM)
Does your child have stiffness or floppiness and/or reduced strength in his/her arms or legs? (GM)
From birth till date, has your child ever had fits, or became rigid, or had sudden jerks or spasms of arms, legs or whole body? (Convulsive Disorder)
From birth till date, has your child ever lost consciousness? (Convulsive Disorder)
Compared to children of his age, does your child find it difficult to read or write or do simple calculations? (C)
Does the child have difficulty in speaking (as compared to other children of his/her age)? (Sp)
Is your child’s speech in any way different from other children of his/her age? (Sp)
Does your child have difficulty in hearing? (without hearing aid)? (H)
Compared with other children of his/her age, does your child have difficulty in sustaining attention on activities at school, home or play? (C)
As compared with other children of his/her age, does your child have difficulty in learning new things? (C)
SCREENING TOOL (FOR AGE: Over 6 to 18 yrs.)
A. Defects at Birth (Identified at 0 - 6 years of age)
Any visible Defect at Birth in the Child like Cleft Lip/Palate/Club foot/Down’s syndrome/ Cataract etc?
Severe anaemia: Look for severe palmar pallor?
Vitamin A Deficiency: Ask for night blindness/look for Bitot’s spot (white patches on sclera)?
Vitamin D Deficiency: Look for Wrist Widening/Bowing of legs?
Goitre: Any swelling in the neck region?
Convulsive Disorders: Did the child ever have had spells of unconsciousness and fits?
Otitis Media: Did the child have more than 3 episodes of ear discharge in last 1 year? Look for Active discharge from ear
Dental Condition: Look for white demineralised / brown tooth, Discolouration, cavitation, Swollen/bleeding/red gums, Visible Plaque/stains
Skin Condition: Does the child c/o itching on skin (especially at night)? Look for round or oval scaly patches/pustules in finger webs. Any other lesion on the skin
Rheumatic Heart Disease: Auscultate for Murmur
Others: Tuberculosis – cough > 2 weeks,Asthma – More than 3 Episodes of increased shortness of breath and difficult breathing and wheezing in past 6 months
LOOK,ASK&PERFORM (GM-Gross Motor, V-Vision, C-Cognition, H-Hearing, Sp-Speech, LD-Learning Disability, ADHD-Attention Deficit Hyperactivity Disorder)
Does the child have difficulty in seeing, either during day or night? (without spectacles) (V)
Compared with other children of his/her age, did the child have any delay in walking? (GM)
Does the child have stiffness or floppiness and/or reduced strength in his/her arms or legs? (GM, NMI)
From birth till date, has the child ever had fits, or became rigid, or had sudden jerks or spasms of arms, legs or whole body? Refer if the fits are uncontrolled (Convulsive Disorder)
Compared to his/her classmates, does the child find it difficult to read or write or to do simple calculations? (LD)
Does the child have any difficulty in speaking as compared to other children of his/her age? (Sp)
Does the child have difficulty in hearing? (without hearing aid) (H)
Compared with other children of his / her age, does the child have difficulty in learning new things? (LD/C)
As compared to children of his/her age, does the child have difficulty in sustaining attention on activities at school, home or play? (ADHD)
E. Adolescent Specific Questionnaire (For Age: Over 10yrs to 18yrs.)
Do you always find it difficult to handle things in your life that has resulted from changes occurring in your body?
Are you able to say "NO" and leave the place when your friends pressurize you to smoke or drink with them?
Do you feel unduly tired early in the morning or you feel depressed most of the time?
In case of females: Have your menstrual cycles started yet?(If not started by 16 years)
Do you have your periods every months (i.e.28 ± 7 days)?
Do you experience any pain or burning sensation while urinating?
Do you have any discharge/ foul smelling discharge from the genitorurinary area?
Do you feel extreme pain during menstruation so much so that it stops you from doing routine activities/ attend schools?
Pain or burning sensation while urinating
Discharge / foul smelling discharge from the genitourinary area
Reason for Admission and Presenting Complaints
Advance decisions to refuse treatment and resuscitation status
Relevant treatment and changes made to treatments
Measures of Physical ability and cognitive functional
Community and specialist services (actions requested / planned / agreed)
Information given to patient and / or authorized representative
Lipid Profile (T Chol, TG, HDL-C, LDL-C, VLDL-C)
Liver Profile (AST, ALT, ALP, T.Bill, D.Bill, TP, Alb)
Thyroid Extended Profile (FT3, FT4, TSH, ANTI TPO)
Diabetes Capsule (FSG, PPSG, S.Crt, Lipid, Profile, HbAIC, Micro Alb)
Diabetes Mini Capsule (S Glucose, HBAIC, Micro Alb)
